Description: Fragment of Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery slim neck-amphora. Neck, siren with head turned back. Body, tongues (dark, white, dark, purple): scales (the lower rows carelessly filled): dividing band of alternate dots: geese feeding, of which two partly preserved, and a bearded man. Purple for two stripes on forepart of bird; on necking ring.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B110)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 585, 3-4)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 121)
